Course Description: The course will introduce reinforcement learning. We will consider exact versions of value and policy iteration, followed by approximations based on gradient methods, temporal difference based methods, and last but not least, simulation based methods like Q-learning.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students will be able to implement and analyze exact dynamic programming (value and policy iteration) algorithms
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students will be able to describe and implement approximations in value and policy space
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students will be able to describe and implement approximations in value and policy space
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students will be able to execute projects using commonly available RL libraries

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: The problem of sequential decision making under uncertainty, Bellman's optimality condition and the dynamic programming methods
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Back of the book problems and psuedo code

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Monte Carlo Methods, Temporal Difference Learning, and n-Step Bootstrapping
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Back of the book problems and psuedo code

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: On Policy Prediction and Control with approximation

Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Paper readings and as part of course project

Textbook: Reinforcement Learning: An introduction by Sutton and Barto
